H0.text: What type of oil is traditionally used to protect cricket bats . Linseed Oil

H1.text: What type of oil is traditionally used to protect cricket bats . Tung Oil

H2.text: What type of oil is traditionally used to protect cricket bats . Coconut Oil

H3.text: What type of oil is traditionally used to protect cricket bats . Alsi

A4.text: raw linseed oil is used, rather than boiled linseed oil, as the raw form is also a drying oil but very slow 'drying', and so the surface remains tacky

A5.text: the bat is traditionally made from willow wood, specifically from a variety of white willow called cricket bat willow (Salix alba var. caerulea), treated with raw (unboiled) linseed oil, which has a protective function
